abstract: Google will tell you insistently that it is not a media company — it organizes and manages content, but does not produce it. Watch closely.
snippet: Google will tell you insistently that it is not a media company — it organizes and manages content, but does not produce it. Watch closely.
lead_paragraph: Today’s quiz: What company derives 96 percent of its revenue from advertising, has a video platform that is currently negotiating with the National Basketball Association, a movie studio and various celebrities, and is developing a subscription service that would be plug-and-play for publishers and consumers the world over.

abstract: Google says China has made it difficult for users to gain access to its e-mail service.
snippet: Google says China has made it difficult for users to gain access to its e-mail service.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Google has accused the Chinese government of disrupting Gmail in the country, making it difficult in the last few weeks for users here to gain access to the company’s popular e-mail service.

headline.main: Google Accuses Chinese of Blocking Gmail Service
headline.print_headline: Google Accuses Chinese Of Blocking Gmail Service

byline.original: By David Barboza and Claire Cain Miller

abstract: The country’s privacy agency imposed a fine of $142,000 and said that Google’s Latitude phone-tracking service continued to violate privacy rules.
snippet: The country’s privacy agency imposed a fine of $142,000 and said that Google’s Latitude phone-tracking service continued to violate privacy rules.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Google’s privacy problems mounted Monday as French regulators fined the company for violating data protection laws and accused it of continuing to flout the rules even though it acknowledged mistakes in collecting data for an online mapping service.

headline.main: Google Faces French Fine for Breach of Privacy
headline.print_headline: Google Faces French Fine For Breach Of Privacy
